issue.title: [C++] Address libparquet SO version convention in unified build
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3185](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3185). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Follow up work to ARROW-3075

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3185?focusedCommentId=16687211) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
It seems that we are using the same ABI version as libarrow.so. Does that sounds reasonable to everyone?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3185?focusedCommentId=16761807) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Any more thoughts on this? I think it's OK to use the same ABI version. If/when we make separate parquet-cpp releases we can determine what to do there

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3185?focusedCommentId=16785487) by Hatem Helal (hatem):*
I brought this up on the [mailing list](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/420bd7b5b4a4bad62bf7d874c998c99204e1633a7d0cf47c00541c61@%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E) and didn't hear objections to the current system of using the same version.  In case it helps I opened a [PR](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3743) with the initial changes that would make this possible but those would need to be seen through once there is a decision to make an independent parquet C++ release.
